reference.scope: STRUCTURE BY NMR OF 138-189 IN COMPLEX WITH ZINC IONS

comment.text: Mediates E3-dependent ubiquitination and proteasomal degradation of target proteins, including p53/TP53, P73, HDAC1 and CDKN1B. Preferentially acts on tetrameric p53/TP53. Monoubiquitinates the translesion DNA polymerase POLH. Contributes to the regulation of the cell cycle progression. Increases AR transcription factor activity.
S-ubiquitinyl-[E2 ubiquitin-conjugating enzyme]-L-cysteine + [acceptor protein]-L-lysine = [E2 ubiquitin-conjugating enzyme]-L-cysteine + N(6)-ubiquitinyl-[acceptor protein]-L-lysine.
Monomer and homodimer. Interacts with AR, p53/TP53, MDM2, HDAC1, KAT5, PLAG1, PLAGL2, CDKN1B, COPE, UBE2D2 and GORAB/NTKLBP1.

isoform.name: Pirh2b
isoform.text: No ubiquitin protein ligase activity. Down-regulated in hepatocellular carcinoma.
No experimental confirmation available. Gene prediction based on EST data.
No experimental confirmation available. Gene prediction based on partial mRNA data.
No experimental confirmation available. Gene prediction based on EST data.

comment.text: Up-regulated during the S phase of the cell cycle. Expressed at low levels during G phase.
Subject to ubiquitination and proteasomal degradation. Interaction with PLAGL2 or KAT5 enhances protein stability.
